pageContext.claim: “I happen to think they [Iran] want to make a deal; they just don't know, really, how to start. And they've been given some bad advice by former Secretary Kerry. It's some very bad advice....And I really think they want to make a deal -- which is the Logan Act, but we'd have to look at the Logan Act. All you have to do is take a look. I think they've been given very bad advice by Secretary Kerry. I think that -- I think they're dying to make a deal.....John Kerry did a tremendous disservice. I think he violated the Logan Act, 100 percent.”
pageContext.analysis: Kerry, the former secretary of state, said he had one conversation with the Iranian foreign minister in Germany after Trump withdrew the United States from the Iran nuclear deal. He denied any inappropriate contacts.
